product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by RihannaGloss Bomb Stix High-Shine Gloss Stick
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeFENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Gloss Bomb Stix High-Shine Gloss Stick: Get luscious shine with this glossy, medium pigment lipstick that's loaded with Vitamin E and Shea Butter, plus Squalane to lock in moisture for up to 8 hours.
details: DetailsBenefitsNourishing + non-sticky feelMedium pigment + luscious shineLocks in moisture for up to 8 hoursLoaded with Squalane, Vitamin E , Shea Butter + Kiwi OilItem 2625832How To UseFor a sheer wash of color, use a tapping motion to apply.For fuller, opaque coverage, use a swiping motion to apply.IngredientsBis-Diglyceryl Polyacyladipate-2, Diisostearyl Malate, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Squalane, Bis-Behenyl/Isostearyl/Phytosteryl Dimer Dilinoleyl Dimer Dilinoleate, Polybutene, Cera Alba/Beeswax/Cire D'abeille, Synthetic Wax, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Polyglyceryl-2 Triisostearate, Aroma/Flavor, Parfum/Fragrance, Caprylyl Glycol, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Aluminum Hydroxide, Polyhydroxystearic Acid, Tocopherol, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Actinidia Chinensis (Kiwi) Seed Oil, Benzyl Benzoate, Limonene. May Contain/Peut Contenir (+/-): Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499), Red 6 Lake (CI 15850), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: For a sheer wash of color, use a tapping motion to apply.For fuller, opaque coverage, use a swiping motion to apply.

reviews.headline: High Shine!
reviews.comments: I love the high shine of this product and the packaging is nice, too.  My only complaint is that it travels into the fine lines around the mouth.  Even with a lip liner, the gloss stick traveled.

reviews.headline: I would buy again
reviews.comments: The gloss stick is so creamy and not sticky. I love how it feels on and looks on my lips

reviews.headline: pigmented, glossy lip
reviews.comments: Love, love this. I have this in two shades: The MVP and Sp'ice Cold. MVP is a beautiful, blue red. Sp'ice Cold is a stunning mauve that I think is a cheeky reference to the Mac lip liner Spice (though I believe the color came out before Mac introduced Cool Spice). Both are amazing colors that go on perfectly and leave behind a wonderful coat of color.

reviews.headline: Not Incentivized
reviews.comments: I love the texture and consistency of these lipsticks. They have a nice shine and feel soft on the lips. No they are not a long lasting lipstick . They do seem to go very quickly too and I get to the end of the stick and end up using a lipstick brush to get it all out.

reviews.headline: love the shine, but not the staying power
reviews.comments: I love the look of the shade I bought - and I have purchased it twice.  I love the taste and the shine, but it quickly goes to...gone.  Think I have to move on.  So, depending on your goal, it's a 3 or a 4.

reviews.headline: best lip gloss
reviews.comments: Rare find: a nude that flatters my skin tone and keeps my lips feeling great.

reviews.headline: Yesss
reviews.comments: Very hydrating. I also love the hisbiscus color I chose for my first fenty gloss stix. It's great everyday wear. I'll be getting more colors!

reviews.headline: The color payoff just isn't it
reviews.comments: The formula is buttery and feels nice, but I should've gotten a nude shade. I got it in The MVP and the color just is not what is pictured. It's blotchy and definitely a berry instead of that blue red that I wanted. Really, really disappointing

reviews.headline: Beautiful!!!!!
reviews.comments: Such a nice color, feels nice on the lips. Wish I didn't have to reapply so often!

reviews.headline: blazd donut will give u bratz doll lips
reviews.comments: I pair blazd donut with a deep brown liner and its the most prettiest 90s nude combo ever. I use it with ct pillow talk deep and let me tell u I feel like a bratz doll. its so comfy and doesnt feel dry or sticky. best lipstick ive ever tried. the scent isnt strong either it smells like peach gummies

reviews.headline: Sooo smooth and buttery and gorg!
reviews.comments: I loooove these. I have three now, two of the high shine and one of the glitter. I just wish the high shine stayed on a bit longer but other than that they just feel and look fantastic!

reviews.headline: I wish.. but no.
reviews.comments: This formula is amazing. Shiny, doesn't crease. The Blaz'd Donut is the perfect color, but the smell is HORRENDOUS. It smells and tastes like cheap lipgloss/playdoh. I can't get over it and sadly will return it for this reason.

reviews.headline: Great consistency and the color is the perfect nude
reviews.comments: This is my new favorite nude lipstick/gloss.  Only pitfall is it doesnt stay on long enough.

reviews.headline: The Bomb Lip Gloss
reviews.comments: Rhianna and her company did it again. High shine, keeps lips soft and the colors are so pretty for all year round.

reviews.headline: I love the Fenty Gloss Bomb Stix
reviews.comments: I love my Gloss Bomb Stix. The variety of colors is great.  It's smooth,  shiny and smell yummy.  I always have one with me.

reviews.headline: Hydrating lipstick
reviews.comments: This is my second time buying this color. It goes on very smooth and doesn't dry out my lips.

reviews.headline: I'm buying this gloss stick forever!!!!
reviews.comments: When I say I am in love, I'm in love. This is my second gloss stick in this shade. I wear it everyday. It pairs so well with other lip products. The combos are endless. It's hydrating, not sticky and brown girl friendly! 1000000/10!!!!

reviews.headline: Can't Stop Reaching For This!!
reviews.comments: The formula for this is soooo dreamy! It's moisturizing, pigmented, and very creamy. RiRi put her whole foot in this baby! I have 3 different colors, and I love them all.

reviews.headline: Beautiful lip color
reviews.comments: Love these lip sticks.  Beautiful color payoff.  Smells so good.  My only small complaint is it is pretty soft so be careful not to roll it up too far.. the tube can get a little messy if I'm not careful.

reviews.headline: An amazing product
reviews.comments: Love it

media.headline: The color payoff just isn't it

faceoff_positive.comments: The Fenty Beauty Gloss Bomb Stix is truly a standout addition to my beauty collection. As someone who values both luxury and functionality in makeup, this gloss stick effortlessly merges the two. The first thing you'll notice is its sleek packagingâ€”sturdy, stylish, and easy to slip into any purse, making it perfect for on-the-go touch-ups. But the real magic happens upon application. The formula strikes the perfect balance between a lip gloss and a lipstick, offering a high-shine finish without any of the stickiness you often get with traditional glosses. The texture glides smoothly over the lips, providing a buttery feel that's deeply moisturizing, thanks to the infusion of lip-loving ingredients like Squalane, Vitamin E, Shea Butter, and Kiwi Oil. This blend locks in moisture for hours, leaving my lips looking plump and hydrated throughout the day. What sets the Gloss Bomb Stix apart from other lip products is its medium pigment payoff paired with that juicy shine. The color is rich without being overpowering, making it versatile enough for both daytime wear and evening glam. Personally, I've found shades like *Two'Lips Kiss* and *High'Biscus* to be ideal for every occasion, whether I'm going for a subtle, polished look or something more vibrant. Another major plus is how comfortable it feelsâ€”even after hours of wear. I don't have to worry about my lips drying out or the gloss settling into fine lines. For anyone looking for a product that combines shine, color, and nourishment, this is a must-try. Fenty Beauty has once again outdone themselves with a product that feels as luxurious as it looks!
faceoff_positive.headline: The Glossiest Yes, RiðŸ’›

faceoff_negative.comments: I was so excited to get the Gloss Bomb Stix High Shine by Fenty Beauty for the obvious reason - it's Fenty, so it's going to be great with two thumbs up. It's going to be a gorgeous color and a gorgeous new formulation. Very happy feet made their way to le postal (fake French for frou frou effect) to retrieve my package and joy of joys, it arrived! I opened the box and my elation courses through my veins. (This is after all, Fenty.) Per usual the packaging is gorgeous. Bliss! The tube portrays the color; mine is "Sorta Selfish", which is perfect for a Basic Beige chick like me. It's a lovely pinkish brown and I knew as soon as I saw the shade that I'd live in it. Opening it and taking that first scent of peachy vanilla was and memorable and gratifying. I tried the color on the back of my hand and jazzed to see the color payoff. This is not a regular gloss. It's a cross between a gloss and a lipstick, leaning a bit more on the lipstick side, hence the color payout. The gloss isn't overly sticky, which is the bane of every long haired person's existence. It's not going to attract those locks like keys, if you get my meaning. Sigh. Beyond that, I don't find anything new or exciting about it. I'm probably not going to purchase this in the near future. It may just be me but I don't enjoy applying it. The shape of the Gloss is an oversize (fat, for lack of a better term) oval. I find I can't apply it comfortably as it is. I have to turn it in a circle as I apply it to maintain contact with an edge on my lip line. Picture that if you can, there's no room for diagrams or even chalk really. For the price, I'd just as soon get a lipstick with a glossy sheen and wear my hair up. Sorry RiRi.
faceoff_negative.headline: A gloss and a lipstick have a baby?
